content.header: Handwritten draft of the Gettysburg Address

hotspots.hotspot: Was delivered on November 19, 1863, at the dedications of the Soldiers' National Cemetery.
Was given to honor those who fought and died during the Battle of Gettysburg.
The battle was considered a turning point in the war.
This became one of the best known speeches in U.S. history.

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

matches.match: an encyclopedia article on witchcraft accusations
a student's essay on the 1860 presidential election
a campaign commercial for Ronald Reagan

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers'.

multiple.question: In which OnBoard for AP United States History module would you expect to analyze this?
There are 5 learning modules in OnBoard for AP United States History.
In AP U.S. History, you'll need to know how to gather and organize information from texts and from images.
The ability to analyze primary sources is NOT a critical skill in AP U.S. History.
You may receive college credit if you perform well on the AP Exam.
Change over Time is considered a high-level interpretive skill.
